content: 1 calypso the kooky owl by sharon maher laughing purple goldfish designs this adorable crochet owl works up in no time using three strands of yarn held together as one and a large hook the pattern is written for four different sizes of owl personally i find them highly addictive and right now i just can t stop making them everyone loves owls they re perfect gifts for a new arrival child s birthday or even a graduation gift and if you don t like the idea of working three strands together just opt for a bulkier yarn instead calypso the kooky owl - by sharon maher of laughing purple goldfish designs ©2013 2 yarn used gauge gauge carnival soft 8 ply dk for the sample 10 sts and 12 row 100% acrylic measure 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4 in worked 80g/153m 2 8oz/167yds in single_crochet us using 6 5 mm hook c1 eggplant 1 ball exact gauge is not important but c2 grey 1 ball stuffing in the finished toy should not be c3 teal 1 ball visible between your stitches c4 white 1 ball if necessary change the hook size to eyes less than 10g of c4 suit your gauge body uses c1 c2 and c3 mini 15g each colour small 25g each colour abbreviations medium 40g each colour standard us abbreviations are used large 60g each colour notions special stitches 6 5 mm crochet hook us k adjustable magic_ring - amr 3 5 mm crochet hook us e  make a loop of yarn by wrapping in a clockwise direction around two fingers wool needle on the left hand  pinch the point where the yarn meets embroidery needle between the thumb and forefinger  slide fingers out so that the ring can 2 x buttons for eyes any size be used  place crochet hook into the centre of small piece of thick felt for beak the ring and pull a loop of the working yarn through - this is the yellow embroidery thread 30cm starting point for the round  work as the pattern instructs for the polyfill stuffing less than 50g remainder of the round - all stitches are worked around both the ring and the tail  when completed the beginning tail finished size can be pulled tight closing the ring mini 10 cm 4 in tall pattern notes small 14 cm 5 ½ in tall the owl is worked in the round from the base to the top all other pieces are medium 18 cm 7 in tall attached to the main body large 22 cm 8 ¾ in tall calypso the kooky owl - by sharon maher of laughing purple goldfish designs ©2013 3 pattern begins please note that the sample owl photographed on the front page is a small owl body the body is worked with three strands of yarn worked together as one use one strand each of c1 eggplant c2 grey and c3 teal begin
